review: I'm going to write basically the same exact review that I left for the Amazon Fire TV, because the Fire Stick is just as terrific a product. This device is simply awesome - especially if you're a Prime member. The only time you will EVER not like this device is being forced to watch the 2 minute guide after the initial setup, but it's a small price to pay for such a great streaming device.The stick and remote are both sleek, and the design of the OS is terrific and smooth. The voice commands work exceptionally well, and the quality of video is outstanding. You could leave the Fire TV exactly as it comes from Amazon and be more than happy with it, but if you're looking to cut ties with cable TV, you can put this box on steroids in about 10 minutes by sideloading Kodi (formerly XBMC) onto the Fire TV Stick. Anyone can do this by following some simple instructions (Google for more info), and I'd highly recommend it myself. Wireless performance is terrific, and with the latest OS upgrades, it makes it easier to bring this with you on the road and use in hotels (you can now accept wireless disclaimer pages for accessing a network, whereas previously you could not).
author: Amazon Customer
